@description.name: @description
@description.body: A tab view is a multi page view where only one page is visible at each moment. It is possible to switch the pages using the buttons rendered by each page. Note that prior to v6.0, when changing the currently selected tab via code (ie changing the selection property) TabView would automatically set the focus to that tab; this is undesirable (and inconsistent with other parts of the framework) and is no longer done automatically.

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: bar {qx.ui.container.SlideBar} slidebar for all tab buttons

@childControl.name: @childControl
@childControl.body: pane {qx.ui.container.Stack} stack container to show one tab page
@childControl.description: stack container to show one tab page

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the selection was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Fires after the value was modified

@description.name: @description
@description.body: This property defines on which side of the TabView the bar should be positioned.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Top padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Right padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Bottom padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Left padding of the content pane

@description.name: @description
@description.body: The 'contentPadding' property is a shorthand property for setting 'contentPaddingTop', 'contentPaddingRight', 'contentPaddingBottom' and 'contentPaddingLeft' at the same time. If four values are specified they apply to top, right, bottom and left respectively. If there is only one value, it applies to all sides, if there are two or three, the missing values are taken from the opposite side.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: setValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: item {null|qx.ui.tabview.Page} Page to set as selected value.
@param.description: Page to set as selected value.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: getValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {null|qx.ui.tabview.Page} The currently selected page or null if there is none.
@return.description: The currently selected page or null if there is none.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: resetValue implements part of the {@link qx.ui.form.IField} interface.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Creates the radio group manager instance. Allows override customizations of the instance

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds a page to the tabview including its needed button (contained in the page).

@param.name: @param
@param.body: page {qx.ui.tabview.Page} The page which should be added.
@param.description: The page which should be added.

@description.body: Adds a page to the tabview including its needed button (contained in the page).

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Removes a page (and its corresponding button) from the TabView.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: page {qx.ui.tabview.Page} The page to be removed.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns TabView's children widgets.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the position of the given page in the TabView.

@param.name: @param
@param.body: page {qx.ui.tabview.Page} The page to query for.

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {Integer} Position of the page in the TabView.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns the radio group manager.

@type.name: @type
@type.body: {Map} Maps the bar position to an appearance state

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Apply method for the placeBarOnTop-Property. Passes the desired value to the layout of the tabview so that the layout can handle it. It also sets the states to all buttons so they know the position of the bar.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns an array of currently selected items. Note: The result is only a set of selected items, so the order can differ from the sequence in which the items were added.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Replaces current selection with the given items.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body:
{Error} if one of the items is not a child element and if
    items contains more than one elements.
@throws.description:
if one of the items is not a child element and if
    items contains more than one elements.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Clears the whole selection at once.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Detects whether the given item is currently selected.

@throws.name: @throws
@throws.body: {Error} if one of the items is not a child element.
@throws.description: if one of the items is not a child element.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Whether the selection is empty.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns all elements which are selectable.

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
all {Boolean} true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
@param.description:
true for all selectables, false for the
   selectables the user can interactively select
